chunks.original_text: 恩惟 太上云云。 某疾病厄难保命医治却杀章一通，上诣 某曹云云。 青丝拔余章 具法位， 上言：某素以胎生，下官子孙，千载有幸云云。 顷者已来，身中轗轲，今岁行年云云。 今谨宝法信，白素四十尺，以进命度厄。 命米一石二斗，以倍粮益算，以添仓储斛斗。 钱一千二百文，以证质丹诚，定三百六十神气，日生一日，安其宫室。 笔、墨、纸、算子，注上生名。 锡人五身，请为某上诣五方，代形易名。 香油灯烛，继续光明。 用钱米质信，以表丹诚，拔赎生命。 上请太上宫中拔命君十二人，续命君十二人，鼎仓王女五人，司命君五人，五纬宫中玉女千二百人，明堂君一人，南昌君一人，朱阳君一人，黄老君一人，天魂地魄君各一人，起生玉女千二百人，玉历素女千二百人，天官地官水府官等各百二十人，并诸官考召君吏，同心并力，为弟子某度脱年命，住处平善，安定无他。 所请天官，依三会言功，吉日举迁，不负效信。 恩惟 太上云云。
chunks.translated_text:
Invoking the boundless grace of the Most High,

A petition for deliverance from illness, calamity, and mortal peril—one document—is hereby submitted to the celestial bureaus.

A writ of exorcism, inscribed on azure silk with the remnants of sacred script, is presented in proper ritual form, proclaiming: From birth, this petitioner, a descendant of the earthly officials and a child of posterity, has been blessed across a thousand generations.

Yet of late, misfortune has clung to this body, and in this year of advancing fate, the petitioner humbly offers precious tokens of faith: forty feet of white silk to secure deliverance from calamity; one *shi* and two *dou* of rice to double provisions and augment life’s allotment, filling the granary’s measures; one thousand two hundred *wen* in coin to attest sincerity, stabilizing the three hundred sixty spirits and *qi*, ensuring their palaces grow daily more secure.

Brush, ink, paper, and counting rods record the petitioner’s name for rebirth. Five effigies are cast to ascend in the petitioner’s stead to the five directions, transforming form and altering name. Fragrant oil and lamps maintain unbroken illumination. These offerings of rice and coin serve as pledges of sincerity, redeeming and ransoming this life.

The petitioner now invokes: twelve Lords of Deliverance from the Most High’s palace; twelve Lords of Life Extension; five Maidens of the Tripod Granary; five Lords of Destiny; one thousand two hundred Jade Maidens of the Five Planetary Palaces; one Lord of the Hall of Light; one Lord of Southern Prosperity; one Lord of Vermilion Yang; one Lord of the Yellow and the Old; one Lord of the Celestial Soul and one of the Earthly Spirit; one thousand two hundred Maidens of Revitalization; one thousand two hundred Maidens of the Jade Calendar; one hundred twenty officials each from the celestial, terrestrial, and water bureaus; and all summoned lords and functionaries of the various offices—may they unite in purpose and strength to deliver this disciple from the trials of fate, ensuring dwelling and abode remain peaceful, stable, and free from harm.

As pledged, the merits of the invoked celestial officials shall be memorialized on the three auspicious assembly days, their ranks elevated on propitious dates, in fulfillment of this vow of devotion.

Invoking once more the boundless grace of the Most High.

chunks.original_text: 疾病医治章 具法位， 上言：云云。 顷日已来染疾，恐没溺生路，诣臣求乞章奏 三天曹，愿为拔赎。 比旬日已来，寒暑不节，胜理失所，或当风外玲，致招此疾，或五刑三灾谪罚。 但以愚塞，不知将何省理。 上请五方生气，以济医治。 特愿 太上无极大道、太上老君、诸君丈人、天师君、三师君、夫人、慈父圣母，留恩省念，赐以道气覆应某身。 谨谒天曹，上手天医、太医君吏十二人，下为某身，随病所在，即为救疗。 上请治病功曹十五人，为某上请天曹，削除某前世今生所犯罪源。 五脏之中，四肢百脉，皆蒙愈差。 次请东方青生气，南方赤生气，西方白生气，北方黑生气，中央黄生气，并下某身中。 又上请解考君、度命君、益算君、防民君、诛殃祸君、游罗大将军、地境大将军，各收邪精、故气、疫毒之鬼，令病者痊复云云。 所请天官，依三会言功迁赏，不负效信。 恩惟 太上分别云云。
chunks.translated_text:

In proper ritual rank, this memorial respectfully states:

As previously reported, this disciple has recently fallen ill, fearing drowning upon the path of life. Humbly approaching this minister, I beseech a memorial be presented to the Three Celestial Bureaus, praying for deliverance and redemption.

For some ten days now, cold and heat have been unbalanced, the pores disordered. Perhaps exposed to drafts or external chill, this illness was thus contracted—or perhaps by the Five Punishments and Three Calamities, a karmic retribution. Yet in my ignorance and obstruction, I know not how to examine and remedy this.

I now invoke the generative qi of the Five Directions to aid in healing. With special reverence, I beseech the Most High and Boundless Dao, the Most High Lord Lao, the Lords and Venerable Ones, the Celestial Master Lord, the Three Master Lords, the Lady, the Compassionate Father, and the Holy Mother—to bestow grace and mindfulness, granting the Dao’s qi to shield and respond to this disciple’s body.

Respectfully, I petition the Celestial Bureau, presenting to the Heavenly Physicians and the Twelve Lords of the Grand Physicians, that they descend to this disciple’s body and, wherever the illness resides, administer healing. I invoke the Fifteen Merit Officers for the Treatment of Illness to beseech the Celestial Bureau, erasing the roots of this disciple’s transgressions from past and present lives. May the five viscera, the four limbs, and the hundred vessels all receive cure and recovery.

Next, I invoke the Eastern Blue Generative Qi, the Southern Red Generative Qi, the Western White Generative Qi, the Northern Black Generative Qi, and the Central Yellow Generative Qi—all to descend into this disciple’s body.

chunks.original_text: 疾病困重收灭灾邪拔命保护章 具法位， 上言：云云。 缘身疾病困重，告急於臣，求乞章奏。 为某所犯罪结尤重，依凭 大道，如蒙哀佑，乞赐进算，令疾病即日痊可。 、谨请阴阳治病功曹、五官医吏，诣凤凰太官日户之中，请取太清五色神药，灌注口中，流布百脉，腹内胸膈之中，痼疾皆能消愈。 木官持药，火官主灸，金官持针，水官主汤，土官和剂，各随所使。 九窍相承，五脏通畅，六腑和调。 上请和考君、太和君、太阳君、延寿君、保命君、度厄君、五帝丈人、都气君，又请高麾大将军、返甲逆鳞兵士三十万众，下为某身五脏六腑、四肢关节、十二宫室，百二十关机，伏乞并力扫除恶鬼。 或系缀某身者，请告天地水三官、五岳四渎、山林孟长、二十四禁忌，并与臣身中所佩刚风赤天骑吏，同共收捕恶鬼。 又愿万福君、天仓君、东方青气君、南方赤气君、西方白气君、北方黑气君、中央黄气君，各领兵士，下为某身中驱遣邪气。 乞蒙平复，延续性命，保守无他。 得如所愿，三会吉日，言功举迁，不负效信。 恩惟 太上分别云云。
chunks.translated_text:
**Petition for the Eradication of Disease, Expulsion of Calamitous Evil, and Protection of Life**

In due observance of ritual protocol, this memorial is respectfully submitted:

Whereas this disciple suffers from grave and grievous illness, I humbly submit this urgent petition, beseeching the submission of a memorial. For the transgressions and karmic entanglements I have incurred are profound. Relying upon the great Dao, should compassionate aid be granted, I implore that my lifespan be extended and my illness cured this very day.

With reverence, I invoke the Yin-Yang Healing Merit Officers and the Five Officials of Medicine to proceed to the Phoenix Celestial Palace, within the Solar Gate, and there procure the Five-Colored Divine Medicines of the Great Purity. May these be poured into my mouth, flowing through the hundred vessels, filling my abdomen and chest, that all chronic ailments may dissolve and heal.

The Wood Official shall administer the medicine; the Fire Official shall preside over moxibustion; the Metal Official shall wield the needle; the Water Official shall prepare the decoction; the Earth Official shall harmonize the formulas—each attending to their appointed task. May the nine orifices align in harmony, the five viscera flow unimpeded, and the six bowels achieve balance.

I further invoke the Lord of Harmonious Longevity, the Lord of Supreme Harmony, the Lord of the Great Yang, the Lord of Lifespan Extension, the Lord of Life Protection, the Lord of Tribulation’s Passage, the Five Thearchs’ Elder, and the Lord of Primal Qi. Additionally, I summon the Great General of the Lofty Standard, along with three hundred thousand troops of the Reversed Armor and Inverted Scales, to descend and purge the evil spirits from my five viscera, six bowels, four limbs, joints, twelve palaces, and one hundred twenty barriers and mechanisms.

Should any evil spirits remain bound to my body, I petition the Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and Water; the Five Marchmounts and Four Waterways; the Mountain and Forest Elders; and the Twenty-Four Taboos—all to join with the Riding Officers of the Crimson Heaven’s Fierce Wind, whom I bear upon my person, in the capture of these malevolent spirits.

Moreover, I entreat the Lord of Myriad Blessings, the Lord of the Celestial Granary, the Lord of the Eastern Blue Qi, the Lord of the Southern Red Qi, the Lord of the Western White Qi, the Lord of the Northern Black Qi, and the Lord of the Central Yellow Qi—each to lead their legions and descend into my body to expel all perverse qi.

May I be restored to health, my life prolonged, and my well-being preserved without mishap. Should this petition be fulfilled, the merits of the celestial officials thus invoked shall be memorialized on the three auspicious assembly days, their ranks elevated in due course, in fulfillment of this vow of devotion. chunks.original_text: 为某身染重疾，困顿在床，拜上拔命保护章一通，上诣 某曹一召万。 扶衰度厄保护章 具法位， 上言：云云。 但某某身忝承下官之胤，因六气以成形，盖万劫之良绿。 沐三光之照曜，处非常之世，得预人流。 以今年灾厄深重，日月长远，贞吉难保，伏闻 大道含泽，拯拔黎民，使枯骨重荣，回骸起死。 某沐此大恩，甚为无量。 或恐厄在东方天狱之中者，请东方青帝甲乙九夷君，从官九九八十一官君，乘青龙，飞行万里，持节执符，主为某解东方青灾、青厄、青瘟、青凶、青毒。 春三月灾祸之气，悉为荡除。 若厄在南方天狱之中者，请南方赤帝丙丁八蛮君，从官八八六十四官君，乘赤龙，飞行万里，持节执符，主为某解除南方赤灾、赤厄、赤瘟、赤凶、赤毒。 夏三月灾祸之气，悉令荡除。 若厄在西方天狱之中者，请西方白帝庚辛六戎君，从官六六三十六官君，乘白龙，飞行万里，持节执符，主为某解除西方白灾、白厄、白瘟、白凶、白毒。 秋三月灾祸之气，悉令荡除。 若厄在北方大狱之中者，请北方黑帝壬癸五狄君，从官五五二十五官君，乘黑龙，飞行万里，持节执符，主为某解除北方黑灾、黑厄、黑瘟、黑凶、黑毒。 冬三月灾祸之气，悉令荡除。 若厄在中央天狱之中者，上请中央黄帝戊己三秦君，从官三三为九、九千二百官君，乘黄龙，飞行万里，持节执符，主为某解除中央黄灾、黄厄、黄瘟、黄凶、黄毒，解除某身中从一厄至于九厄八难，并乞消除。 又请 皇天上帝、日月五星、五帝王相、华盖北斗君、三天却录司命君，一合下为某解除三灾九厄，并解今年瘟黄瘴气，悉皆远离身心。 即日奉资仪信白素绢一匹，命米一石二斗，镇钱一千二百文，油一十二升，香灯纸笔等，以为效信，表质丹诚。 上请 太上三天解死籍，上生名，削除万病之厄，家口平安，道力扶助，职禄求迁。 蒙恩之日，所请天官吏兵，依臣三会吉日言功，不负效信。 恩惟 太上云云。

For my afflicted body, stricken with grave illness and confined to bed, I reverently present this *Memorial for Life-Prolonging Protection*, submitting it to the [Celestial] Bureau of [N.N.]. Herein lies the *Memorial for Support in Decline and Deliverance from Calamity*, duly inscribed with its ritual rank and addressed as follows:

I, [N.N.], unworthy heir to a minor official’s lineage, was formed through the six qi and owe my existence to ten thousand kalpas of good fortune. Bathed in the radiance of the Three Luminaries, I dwell in this extraordinary age and have been granted a place among humankind. Yet this year, my misfortunes run deep, and the days stretch long; even my constancy and blessings are imperiled. I have heard that the Great Dao, in its boundless grace, rescues the common people, reviving withered bones and restoring the dead to life. Having received this immeasurable mercy, I am profoundly grateful.

Should my calamity lie within the Eastern Celestial Prison, I entreat the Azure Emperor of the East, Lord of Jia-Yi and the Nine Yi Tribes, along with his retinue of eighty-one officials, to mount the Azure Dragon, traverse ten thousand leagues, and wield their tablets and talismans to dissolve for me the azure disasters, azure calamities, azure pestilences, azure misfortunes, and azure poisons of the East. May all baleful qi of the three spring months be utterly swept away.

Should my calamity lie within the Southern Celestial Prison, I entreat the Vermilion Emperor of the South, Lord of Bing-Ding and the Eight Man Tribes, along with his retinue of sixty-four officials, to mount the Vermilion Dragon, traverse ten thousand leagues, and wield their tablets and talismans to dissolve for me the vermilion disasters, vermilion calamities, vermilion pestilences, vermilion misfortunes, and vermilion poisons of the South. May all baleful qi of the three summer months be utterly swept away.

Should my calamity lie within the Western Celestial Prison, I entreat the White Emperor of the West, Lord of Geng-Xin and the Six Rong Tribes, along with his retinue of thirty-six officials, to mount the White Dragon, traverse ten thousand leagues, and wield their tablets and talismans to dissolve for me the white disasters, white calamities, white pestilences, white misfortunes, and white poisons of the West. May all baleful qi of the three autumn months be utterly swept away.

Should my calamity lie within the Northern Celestial Prison, I entreat the Black Emperor of the North, Lord of Ren-Gui and the Five Di Tribes, along with his retinue of twenty-five officials, to mount the Black Dragon, traverse ten thousand leagues, and wield their tablets and talismans to dissolve for me the black disasters, black calamities, black pestilences, black misfortunes, and black poisons of the North. May all baleful qi of the three winter months be utterly swept away.

Should my calamity lie within the Central Celestial Prison, I entreat the Yellow Emperor of the Center, Lord of Wu-Ji and the Three Qin Tribes, along with his retinue of nine thousand two hundred officials, to mount the Yellow Dragon, traverse ten thousand leagues, and wield their tablets and talismans to dissolve for me the yellow disasters, yellow calamities, yellow pestilences, yellow misfortunes, and yellow poisons of the Center. May all calamities from the first to the ninth, and all eight adversities afflicting my body, be dispelled.

Furthermore, I entreat the August Heavenly Thearch, the Sun and Moon and Five Planets, the Five Thearchs and their Ministers, the Lord of the Canopy and Northern Dipper, and the Lords of the Three Heavens’ Registers and Life-Commands to descend as one and dissolve for me the three disasters and nine calamities, as well as this year’s pestilential miasmas and jaundiced vapors, driving them far from body and mind.

Today, I offer in devotion: one bolt of white silk, one *shi* and two *dou* of rice, one thousand two hundred cash coins, twelve *sheng* of oil, and incense, lamps, paper, and brushes as tokens of my sincerity. By this offering, I pledge my unwavering faith.

I reverently petition the Most High of the Three Heavens to erase my name from the Register of the Dead and inscribe it in the Register of the Living, excising all afflictions of the myriad illnesses. May my household enjoy peace, may the Dao’s power sustain me, and may my office and salary be advanced. On the day this grace is bestowed, may the celestial officials and their legions, in accordance with the three auspicious assembly days, be duly rewarded for their merits, and may this vow of devotion not be in vain.

With gratitude, I reverently distinguish the grace of the Most High.

chunks.original_text: 上言：某若干人，住宅不安，虑触冥司，招延考气。 以今年运，五毒流行，中伤天民，不择良善。 盖某以胎生无知，下官子孙，千载幸会，得奉大道，常怀恐惧，无地自安。 顷者家口大小，处在其中，不自保持，忧虑尤切。 为比年或有修补掘凿，移篱换柱，事非一条，触犯天禁地忌、太阳太岁将军、神头神足，行年本命、大虚小耗、灾杀劫杀、勾陈白虎、十二时神、土灵土杀，一切虚耗，上下土官，虑有触犯，致某家舍宇宅神不安，井鳌龙神之主不为利便。 愿与某安稳，宅舍迁达，各得安居。 谨按天师千二百官章，上请卿邑大夫神君官将百二十人下，为某家分解前后所犯禁忌，并乞消除。 伏请制地君五人，官将一百二十人，为解太岁太阴太阳大将军、大小虚耗、蚕室畜官、上下禁忌之鬼，一切并乞消灭。 谨请东方青帝九夷君，南方赤帝八蛮君，西方白帝六戎君，北方黑帝五狄君，中央黄帝三秦君，四季五土，更相分气，及四方官将，并为某家宅中收除禁忌，千精万邪，下官故气，岁月日时，灾杀破害之鬼，一切消灭。 五帝安宅，诸祸不生，利佑一岁之中，四时安稳，八节无灾，二十四气相应，乾上广覆，坤下普载，永享贞吉。 震生青龙，治宅左。 离生赤龙，治宅前。 兑生白龙，治宅右。 坎生黑龙，治宅后。 坤生黄龙，镇宅中央。 五龙治宅，辟除不祥，消灭凶恶，扫荡千殃。 神龙安镇，四邻和睦。 改逆从顺，除前愆，成后善。 道气流行，宅舍清吉。 仕宦高迁，所求如意。 从心之日，不负效信。 恩惟 太上分别。 求哀。 云云。
chunks.translated_text:
**Petition to the Celestial Court:**

We, the undersigned [number] persons, humbly submit: our dwelling has been unsettled, and we fear we have unwittingly offended the netherworld authorities, thereby inviting the influx of baleful *qi*. In this year’s celestial cycle, the Five Poisons spread unchecked, afflicting the people of heaven without regard for the virtuous or the base.

We, born of the womb in ignorance, descendants of the lower officials, have by a thousand generations’ fortune been granted the grace to serve the Great Dao. Yet we remain ever fearful, finding no ground upon which to rest secure. Recently, our household—elders and children alike—has dwelt within this troubled abode, unable to safeguard ourselves, our anxieties deepening.

In recent years, we may have undertaken repairs, excavations, or renovations—moving fences, replacing pillars—matters of no single kind, yet all risking transgression against the celestial prohibitions and earthly taboos: the Generals of the Great Sun and the Grand Year-Star, the spirits of heads and feet, the *qi* of one’s ruling year and life destiny, the Great and Lesser Depletions, the baleful stars of calamity and misfortune, the Hooking Chen and White Tiger, the spirits of the twelve hours, the earthly numina and earthly slayers, all manner of depletions, and the officials of the upper and lower earth. We fear such offenses have caused the spirits of our dwelling to grow restless, and the dragon deities presiding over our well and hearth to withhold their favor. We pray that our household may be granted stability, our dwelling prosper, and all within find peace.

Invoking the *Petition of the Twelve Hundred Officials of the Celestial Master*, we reverently beseech the descent of one hundred twenty divine lords, generals, and officials, led by the *Qingyi* Great Masters, to absolve our household of all past and present transgressions and to dissolve them entirely. We humbly entreat the Five Lords of the Earth and their one hundred twenty officials to dispel the Generals of the Grand Year-Star, Great Yin, and Great Sun; the Great and Lesser Depletions; the spirits of silkworm chambers and livestock; and all ghosts bound by upper and lower prohibitions—may they be utterly eradicated.

We reverently summon:
- The Nine Lords of the Eastern Yi, under the Azure Emperor,
- The Eight Lords of the Southern Man, under the Vermilion Emperor,
- The Six Lords of the Western Rong, under the White Emperor,
- The Five Lords of the Northern Di, under the Black Emperor,
- The Three Lords of the Central Qin, under the Yellow Emperor,

along with the *qi* of the four seasons and the five earths, mutually dividing their influences, and the officials and generals of the four directions. May they descend to our dwelling to purge all prohibitions, the thousand spirits and ten thousand demons, the lingering *qi* of the lower officials, and the baleful ghosts of years, months, days, and hours—all calamities, ruptures, and harms—may they be utterly dissolved.

May the Five Emperors pacify this dwelling, and may no misfortunes arise. May blessings and protection abide through the year, the four seasons pass in tranquility, the eight solar terms remain free of disaster, and the twenty-four *qi* nodes align in harmony. May Heaven above broadly cover, and Earth below universally bear, that we may forever enjoy steadfast fortune.

- The Azure Dragon of *Zhen* governs the left of the dwelling,
- The Vermilion Dragon of *Li* governs the front,
- The White Dragon of *Dui* governs the right,
- The Black Dragon of *Kan* governs the rear,
- The Yellow Dragon of *Kun* guards the center.

May the Five Dragons govern this dwelling, repelling all inauspiciousness, dissolving all malevolence, and sweeping away a thousand woes. May the divine dragons bring peace and stability, fostering harmony among the four neighbors. May rebellion be transformed into obedience, past transgressions erased, and future goodness accomplished. May the *qi* of the Dao flow freely, rendering the dwelling pure and auspicious. May officials ascend in rank, all desires be fulfilled, and the day of heart’s contentment arrive—without fail or betrayal of trust.

We implore the Most High to discern and grant our plea. We beseech with lamentation. Thus concludes this petition.

chunks.original_text: 为某家恐居宅不安，龙神不利，禁忌挠动，谨拜上，上请 天官将吏，乞为收除鬼气，安慰冥司，迎请五龙安宅保护人口乞恩宝章一通，上诣 某曹云云。 断瘟毒疫章 具法位，上言：云云。 即日自列，千载有幸，得奉大道，被蒙恩覆，以自营卫。 但某百行多违，招延考气，大小疾病，日转有增。 诣臣求乞章奏，令瘟气断绝。 臣以暗昧，不明鬼气，按天师千二百官章，有下官故气，邪淫鬼贼，周天匝地，妄生灾祸，克害良民。 伏闻 太上高尊，三天清远，宇宙广大，日月光明，无所不照，行邪之鬼，并皆诛灭。 若是东方生青瘟青毒青痉，鬼名高远。 在南方生赤瘟赤毒赤症，鬼名士言。 在西方生白瘟白毒白症，鬼名白幸。 在北方生黑瘟黑毒黑疰，鬼名大黄奴，父子七人，男女兄弟各行恶毒疫气。 正月至十二月，各有瘟鬼，随其放逸，天下病害。 又甲子乙丑寅卯辰巳午未申酉戌亥十二月辰，瘟鬼皆有名字。 从十二时上来，五方五色，黄奴老虫。 致今末世，愚民逢祸，致死不可称计。 臣受法之日，约当助国扶命，医治百姓，按如科文，诛灭邪伪，扫除逆鬼，皆令灭绝。 臣备受治职，谨当伏地拜章，上闻 太上无极大道诸君丈人，鸿恩覆护某家，悉与扫荡群精，灭绝恶鬼根本。 上官使者，时蒙断省。 愿东方主斗成主绝青瘟，南方主斗平主绝赤瘟，西方主斗迁主绝白瘟，北方主斗长主绝黑瘟，中央主五父君主绝黄瘟。 东西南北，四维上下，十二时神，并令营卫恶鬼，无令放入。 又东方青帝、南方赤帝、西方白帝、北方黑帝，四方一时，同临佑助。 上请高天万丈百鬼中王万二千人，兵士各八十万众，与臣身中吏兵，及守宅三将军、二十四吏、兵士三十万人，并刀同心，盖屋三重，绕宅二市，兵刃向外，一时扫荡，凶逆邪精，并令消灭。 所请天官，言功报劳，不负效信。 恩惟

For the household of [Certain Family], fearing that their dwelling may be unsettled, the Dragon spirits unfavorable, and taboos obstructed, I humbly present this petition. I earnestly appeal to the **Celestial Officials** and their subordinates, beseeching them to:

- Remove the malevolent *qi* of ghosts,
- Soothe the **Netherworld Officials** (*Míngsī*),
- Invite the Five Dragons to dwell and protect the premises and its occupants.

I pray for a **Precious Charter of Grace** (*Enbǎo zhāng*) to be granted and delivered to the [Certain] Bureau, thus:

---
**Charter of Plague Eradication** (*Duànwēn dúyì zhāng*)
With due respect to the **Celestial Hierarchy** (*Dàodào*), I submit:

- May the **Celestial Officials** (*Shàngguān*) command the cessation of the plague.
- Though I am dim-witted and ignorant of the malevolent *qi* of ghosts, according to the **Thousand and Two Hundred Officials’ Charter** (*Tiānshī qiān èr bǎi guān zhāng*), there exist **Lowly Officials** (*Xiàguān*) of *qi*, along with **Licentious Ghosts** and **Bandit Spirits** (*Yéyín guǐ zéi*), encircling the **Heavenly Circuit** (*Zhōutiān*) and the Earth, recklessly generating calamities and afflicting virtuous folk.

- I have heard that the **Most High** (*Tàishàng*), in His lofty exaltation, rules the **Three Heavens** (*Sāntiān*) with purity and distance, His universe vast, His **Sun and Moon** radiant, illuminating all things without exception. All malevolent ghosts are thus slain and annihilated.

If so, then:
- In the **East**, the **Green Plague** (*Qīngwēn*), **Green Toxin** (*Qīngdú*), and **Green Spasm** (*Qīngjìng*) arise, with the ghost named **High Reach** (*Gāoyuǎn*).
- In the **South**, the **Red Plague** (*Chìwēn*), **Red Toxin** (*Chìdú*), and **Red Sickness** (*Chìzhèng*) arise, with the ghost named **Scholar’s Speech** (*Shìyán*).
- In the **West**, the **White Plague** (*Báiwēn*), **White Toxin** (*Báidú*), and **White Sickness** (*Báizhèng*) arise, with the ghost named **White Fortune** (*Báixìng*).
- In the **North**, the **Black Plague** (*Hēiwēn*), **Black Toxin** (*Hēidú*), and **Black Epidemic** (*Hēizhòu*) arise, with the ghost named **Great Yellow Slave** (*Dàyuán núláo*), along with his seven sons, and male and female siblings, each propagating their own malevolent plague *qi*.

From the **First Month** to the **Twelfth Month**, each has its own plague ghosts, spreading freely and causing suffering throughout the land.

Moreover, in the **years of Jiazi, Yichou, Rényǐn, Mǎodǐng, Chénwèi, Sìwǔ, Wèiwǔ, Shēnshēn, Yǒuyǒu, Xǔyǒu, Hàiyǒu**, and the **Twelfth Month of Chén**, each plague ghost bears a name and rank.

From the **Twelve Earthly Branches** (*Shíèr shí*) of the day, the Five Directions, Five Colors, and the **Yellow Slave** (*Huángnúláo*)—the **Old Vermin** (*Lǎochóng*)—all descend upon us.

In this degenerate age, the foolish populace face calamities without end, dying in numbers beyond count.

Since the day I received the **Dao**, I have sworn to aid the nation and sustain life, to heal the people, and according to the **Scriptures of the Celestial Hierarchy** (*Kēwén*), to exterminate falsehoods and sweep away rebellious ghosts, all of which I have done.

Having been entrusted with this sacred office, I now humbly prostrate myself in petition, praying that the **Most High** (*Tàishàng*), the **Supreme Dao of the Limitless** (*Wújí Dàodào*), and all the **Honorable Lords** (*Zhūjūn zhàngrén*), may cover my household with Your boundless grace, utterly rooting out all malevolent spirits and eradicating their essence.

The **Celestial Officials** (*Shàngguān*)’s envoys shall, in due time, grant this decree.

I pray that:
- The **East**’s **Celestial Official** (*Qīngdì*) command **Victory** (*Chéng*) and **Absolute Cessation** (*Jué*) of the **Green Plague**,
- The **South**’s **Celestial Official** (*Chìdì*) command **Peace** (*Píng*) and **Absolute Cessation** (*Jué*) of the **Red Plague**,
- The **West**’s **Celestial Official** (*Báidì*) command **Exile** (*Qiān*) and **Absolute Cessation** (*Jué*) of the **White Plague**,
- The **North**’s **Celestial Official** (*Hēidì*) command **Lengthening** (*Cháng*) and **Absolute Cessation** (*Jué*) of the **Black Plague**,
- The **Central**’s **Five Father Lords** (*Wǔfùjūn*) command **Absolute Cessation** (*Jué*) of the **Yellow Plague** (*Huángwēn*).

For the **Four Cardinal Directions** (*Dōngxī nánběi*), the **Four Intermediate Directions** (*Sìwéi*), the **Twelve Branches of Time** (*Shíèr shí*), and all spirits within, may they all be commanded to guard against malevolence, preventing it from entering.

Furthermore, the **Celestial Sovereigns** (*Dì*) of the **East** (*Qīngdì*), **South** (*Chìdì*), **West** (*Báidì*), and **North** (*Hēidì*), in their singular power, shall simultaneously descend and bestow aid.

I earnestly appeal to the **King of Ten Thousand Ghosts** (*Bāi guǐ zhōngwáng*) of the **High Heavens** (*Gāotiān*), with **Twelve Thousand** (*Wàn èr qiān*) soldiers, each commanding **Eight Hundred Thousand** (*Bāi shíwàn*) troops, to join with the **subordinate officers** (*Shēnzhōng yìbīng*) within my person, as well as the **Three Generals** (*Sān jiāngjūn*) who guard this dwelling, the **Twenty-Four Officials** (*Èrshísì lì*), and the **Three Hundred Thousand** (*Sān bǎi shíwàn*) soldiers, all with blades in unison, encircling the dwelling in **three layers** (*Sāncéng*), and **two markets** (*Èr shì*) around the perimeter, their weapons pointing outward, to sweep away in one moment all malevolent, rebellious, and licentious spirits, utterly annihilating them.

The **Celestial Officials** (*Shàngguān*) shall, upon hearing my plea, reward my labor faithfully, without failing to fulfill my earnest trust.

I pray with deepest reverence.

chunks.original_text: 太上分别云云。 为某家拜请天官乞恩，防断疾病，并邻里疾病。 请五方天官收捕五瘟疫疠鬼贼章一通，上诣 三天曹云云。 赤松子章历卷之三竟 赤松子章历卷之四 断魁泉章 具法位， 上言：云云。 某即日叩头自列，口乞恩辞，素以胎生，千载庆幸，得奉 大道，忝切蒙恩。 顷者已来，居处轗轲，疾病相连。 卜筮云是山泉三河为祸，并此间土地山林觅食之鬼侵害某身，忧怖屏营，不知修何功德，唯用一心，上凭 大道，以救性命。 告诉向臣，求乞章奏，收除里域东西南北山泉四垄河中诸杂鬼神横行祸祟之者，一切乞令收断。 臣职叨典治、谨为伏地拜章一通，乞 太上老君、太上丈人垂恩料省，原赦某身，恐是山丘垄泉三河五河乳母等鬼作此妨害，上请麾幢大将军、陂湖大将军各五人，返甲逆鳞大将军五人，兵士一万人，重请觅音大将军官将各百二十人，摇天动地九气君吏兵士一千二百人，请左灵君、右灵君、高天大将军、盟威君、八卦君，各宫将百二十人，上请束方九夷君、九九八十一官君、寅卯辰甲乙君、南方八蛮君、八八六十四官君、巳午未丙丁君、西方六戎君、六六三十六官君、申酉戌庚辛君、北方五狄君、五五二十五官君、亥子丑壬癸君、中央三秦戊己君千二百人，上请诛符破庙君万六千人、太阴太阳太医君、治病功曹官将兵士各百二十人，同心并力，下为某收捕鬼贼，付与天丁力士、天一北狱，依法治罪，不令脱漏。 上章之后，悉令断绝，蒙恩之日，以为效信。 恩惟

The **Supreme Sovereign** (*Tàishàng*) decrees as follows:

For the sake of the **House of [Name]**, I humbly beseech the **Celestial Officials** (*Tiānguān*) for their grace, to **sever and terminate** (*fángduàn*) all diseases, and likewise those of neighboring households.

I submit a **petition** (*zhāng*) to the **Five-Direction Celestial Officials** (*Wǔfāng Tiānguān*) to **apprehend and capture** (*shōuchǔ*) the **Five Plagues** (*Wǔwēn yì*) and all **malignant pestilential spirits** (*lìguǐ zéizéi*), the **bandit ghosts** (*biéguǐ*), and the **demonic chapters** (*zhāng*), in one unified document, and present it to the **Three Celestial Tribunals** (*Sān Tiān Cáo*).

**The Chapter of the Red Pine Child** (*Chìsōngzǐ zhāng* – *Volume III completed*), **The Chapter of the Red Pine Child** (*Volume IV completed*), **The Chapter of the Severed Ghostly Leader** (*Duàn Kuíquán zhāng*), and **The Chapter of the Proper Ritual Rank** (*Jùfǎ wèi zhāng*)—

I now **solemnly vow** (*[Name] jí rì kuāitóu zìliè*) with bowed head, **pleading in words** (*kǒu qǐ ēncí*), born of **the Pure Dao** (*sù yǐ tāishēng*), a thousand generations of joyous fortune, to have **received and honored the Great Way** (*dé fèng Dàdào*), though unworthy, and **gratefully accepted their grace**.

Recently, these spirits have **descended and encroached** (*qǐngzhě yǐ lái jūchù niǎnqì*), with diseases **interconnectedly afflicting** (*jíbìng xiānglián*) me. The **divination** (*bǔshù*) reveals that **mountain springs and three rivers** (*shānguān sān hé*) are the **cursed sources** (*wéihuò*), and that **ghosts dwelling in the nearby lands, mountains, and forests** (*jīncì jiān tǔdì shānlín mìshí zhī guǐ*), seeking sustenance, are **harassing my person** (*qīnhài [Name] shēn*). In **fear and dread**, I have **warded off and fortified my dwelling** (*yōubù píngyíng*), yet I **know not what virtue/power** (*gōngdé*) to cultivate. With **one heart**, I **entrust myself to the Great Way** (*shàngpíng Dàdào*) to **save my life and command**.

I **instruct the subordinate officers** (*gàosù xiàng chén*) to submit a **petition for mercy** (*qiǔqǐ zhāngzòu*), **apprehending and expelling** (*shōuchú*) all **ghostly deities and spirits** (*zázhǒng guǐshén*) from the **four directions** (*lǐyù dōngxī nánběi*)—**mountain springs, four ridges, and rivers** (*shānguān sì lǒng hézhōng*)—that **ravage and oppress** (*héngxíng huòsuì*). I **beg that all be ordered to cease**.

I, **[Name]**, by **virtue of my official duties** (*chén zhí dāo diǎn zhì*), **humble myself in reverence** (*jǐn wéi fú dì bǎizhāng*), beseeching the **Supreme Sovereign, the Old Lord** (*Tàishàng Lǎojūn*), and the **Supreme Sovereign, the Venerable Sage** (*Tàishàng Zhàngrén*), to **extend their grace and consider** (*chuí’ēn liàoshěng*), **pardon me** (*yuánshè [Name] shēn*), lest **mountains, hills, ridges, and five rivers** (*shāngqiū lǒngquán wǔ hé*) along with **ghostly midwives** (*rǔmǔ*) and other spirits **obstruct and harm** (*zuò cǐ fánghài*). I **solemnly request** the **Great Standard-Bearer General** (*Wéizhuàng Dàjiāngjūn*), the **Great Marsh-and-Lake General** (*Bēihú Dàjiāngjūn*), and the **Great Reverse-Armor General** (*Fǎnjiǎ Nìxīn Dàjiāngjūn*), each **five officers** (*gè wǔ rén*), as well as **ten thousand soldiers** (*yī wàn bīngshì*). I **earnestly pray** for the **Great General of the Resonant Sound** (*Qǐnyīn Dàjiāngjūn*) and the **Great General of the Officials** (*Guānjiāng*), each **one hundred and twenty officers** (*gè bǎizhí rén*), and the **Nine Qi Generals and Soldiers** (*Yáotiān Dòngdì Jiǔqì Jūn lìbīng*), **one thousand two hundred soldiers** (*yī qiān èr bǎi rén*). I **request** the **Left Spirit Lord** (*Zuǒ Língjūn*), the **Right Spirit Lord** (*Yòu Língjūn*), the **Great General of the High Heaven** (*Gāotiān Dàjiāngjūn*), the **Lord of the Sacred Oath** (*Méngwēi Jūn*), and the **Lord of the Eight Trigrams** (*Bāguà Jūn*), each with **one hundred and twenty officers** (*gè bǎizhí rén*). I **request** the **Lord of the Nine Di** (*Shùfāng Jiǔyí Jūn*), the **Eighty-One Officials** (*Jiǔjiǔ Bāshíyī Guānjūn*), the **Lords of the Hours and Days** (*Yínmǎo Zhēnjiǎn Yǐwèi Jūn*), the **Eight Snar** (*Nánfāng Bāwàn Jūn*), the **Sixty-Four Officials** (*Bābā Liùshísì Guānjūn*), the **Lords of the Solar Hours** (*Wèihú Wèijiǎn*), the **Six Rong** (*Xīfāng Liùróng Jūn*), the **Thirty-Six Officials** (*Liùliù Sānshíliù Guānjūn*), the **Lords of the Western Hours** (*Shēnyǒu Xū Gēngxīn Jūn*), the **Five Di** (*Běifāng Wǔdí Jūn*), the **Twenty-Five Officials** (*Wǔwǔ Èrshíwǔ Guānjūn*), the **Lords of the Northern Hours** (*Hàizǐ Chuǐ Rénwèi Jūn*), and the **Three Qin** (*Zhōngyāng Sānqín Wùjǐ Jūn*), **one thousand two hundred officers** (*qiān èr bǎi rén*).

I **request** the **Great Generals of the Execution Seal** (*Zhūfú Pòmiào Jūn*), **ten thousand six thousand officers** (*wàn liù qiān rén*), the **Great Generals of the Great Yin and Yang** (*Tàiyīn Tàiyáng Dàyījūn*), and the **Great Generals of the Medical Functionaries** (*Zhìbìng Gōngcáo*), each with **one hundred and twenty officers** (*gè bǎizhí rén*), to **unify their hearts and exert their strength** (*tóngxīn bìnglì*), **apprehend and capture the demonic spirits** (*xià wéi [Name] shōubǔ guǐzéi*), and **deliver them to the Heavenly Executioners and the Northern Prison** (*Fùyǔ Tiāndīng Lìshì, Tiānyī Běiyù*), **punishing them according to law** (*yīfǎ zhìzuì*), **without allowing escape or oversight**.

After this **petition is submitted** (*shàngzhāng zhīhòu*), I **command all spirits to sever their connection** (*xīliǎo duànjué*). On the day of **received grace** (*méng’ēn zhī rì*), I shall **take this as my earnest trust** (*wéi xiàogào*).

With deepest reverence,
**The Petitioner** (*[Name] ēnwéi*).

chunks.original_text: 太上云云。 为某收断河泉恶鬼章一通，上诣 某曹，伏须告报。 解天罗地网章 具法位， 上言：云云。 某身及妻子，并有厄难，恐为天罗地网以见缠结，告诉向臣，求乞章一通。 臣以学浅，不明气候，无精算术，皆凭六甲五行更相剥复，以知历数。 凡以戌亥绝阳之乡为天罗，辰巳绝阴之地为地网。 年命会此则受其殃。 男以本命临太岁功曹，加生月为天罗传送，加胎月为地网。 女以本命临行年为天罗河魁，加胎月为地网。 复以行年临本命功曹，加胎月为天罗传送，加生月为地网。 又天纲临太一，下为天罗。 胎在登明，下为地纲。 五刑六害七伤九厄之月，及以衰年衰月，魁纲杂杀，千凶万患，妨损非一。 恐某家大小年命有犯五方罗网，九宫八卦，更相克伐，仍是九天玄极之气下游世间，纵横九百九里。 罗者如炎火，网者如黑云，悉带九星精气，赤精焕烂，若人年命当之，立见凶损。 某今资法信，素绢一匹，钱一千二百文，白米一石二斗，油一斗二升，纸一百二十张，朱绳一百二十尺，钏子一双，素丝一两，笔墨香灯等，伏惟 天官恩盼，太上无极大道、天师门下典者、五气君，垂神省念，上请东方寅卯辰甲乙青气君，解除东方青厄青毒； 南方巳午未丙丁赤气君，解除南方赤厄赤毒； 西方申酉戌庚辛白气君，解除西方白厄白毒； 北方亥子丑壬癸黑气君，解除北方黑厄黑毒； 中央戊己黄气君，解除中央黄厄黄毒。 五方之气，十二时候，皆不敢为害。 臣闻上三五为天，中三五为人，下三五为地。 天有五行，地有五气，人有五常。 天不失五行则日月精明，地不失五气则万物滋生，人不失五常则能生长，礼乐获全。 某家恐五气不合，脏腑不调，五行更相克剥，伏愿上官典者，为某上解玄象五星之考气，下解地上三十六禁忌，中解某等身中千罪万过。 谨请北斗七星贪狼巨门断绝死源，禄存廉贞替易死形，文曲武曲削除死录。 谨请解厄君、太皇万福君、运气君、玉历君，各官将百二十人，下为某收捕众灾，分解诸厄，从一厄至于九厄，所居里域，真官注气，监察考召，太祖父母，家亲丈人，一切迁举，进入中宫，署与功赏，使分曹署职，随功加秩，天曹科典，令存亡受恩，幽明相佑，要以某身年命延长，灾厄度脱，以为效信。 恩惟 太上分别。

**The Most High declares as follows:**

For the **Petition to Sever the River-Spring Malevolent Spirits** (*Shòu Duàn Hé Quán Èguǐ Zhāng*), one copy, submitted to **[Name]’s Bureau**, humbly awaiting notification.

**Petition for the Dissolution of Heavenly Nets and Earthly Snares** (*Jiě Tiānluó Dìwǎng Zhāng*), with proper ritual rank and position, states as follows:

*"My body and family suffer afflictions and calamities, fearing ensnarement by the Heavenly Nets and Earthly Snares. I have petitioned the officials, seeking this scroll for deliverance. Due to my limited learning, I do not grasp the **qi** and seasons, nor possess refined numerology. I rely solely on the **Six Jia** and **Five Phases** to determine cycles and fate.*

*By tradition, the **Steel-Hai** direction (absolute **yang**) is the **Heavenly Net**, while the **Chen-Si** direction (absolute **yin**) is the **Earthly Snare**. When one’s fate aligns with these, disaster follows. For men, if their **birth year** clashes with the **Tàisuì** (Yearly Official), their **birth month** becomes the **Heavenly Net’s transmission**, and their **conception month** the **Earthly Snare**. For women, if their **birth year** clashes with the **current year**, their **conception month** becomes the **Heavenly Net’s River Chief**, and their **birth month** the **Earthly Snare**. Additionally, if the **current year** clashes with their **birth year’s Tàisuì**, their **conception month** becomes the **Heavenly Net’s transmission**, and their **birth month** the **Earthly Snare**. Further, when the **Heavenly Halter** aligns with **Tàiyī**, it becomes the **Heavenly Net**. If the fetus resides in **Dēngmíng**, it becomes the **Earthly Halter**. Months of **Five Punishments, Six Calamities, Seven Injuries, and Nine Afflictions**, as well as years and months of decline, or when **Halter and Chief** clash in lethal combinations—these bring myriad disasters and misfortunes, causing untold harm.*

*I fear my household’s fate may collide with the **Five Directions’ Nets**, the **Nine Palaces and Eight Trigrams**, their mutual assaults, or the **Nine Heavens’ Primordial Qi** descending into the mortal realm, spanning **Nine Hundred and Ninety Li** in all directions. The **Net** burns like flames, the **Snare** looms like black clouds, both infused with the **Nine Stars’ essence**, their **Red Precision** blazing. If my fate aligns with these, ruin is immediate.*

*Now, I offer **ritual efficacy**—one bolt of undyed silk, **1,200 coins**, **12 dou of white rice**, **1.2 sheng of oil**, **120 sheets of paper**, **120 feet of red cord**, a pair of **handcuffs**, **1 liang of raw silk**, ink, brushes, incense, and lamps—humbly praying that the **Celestial Officials**, the **Most High’s Boundless Dao**, the **Heavenly Master’s Gate**, the **Five Qi Lords**, and the **Typists of Records** may deign to intervene:

- **East: Yín-Mǎo-Chén (Wood Qi Lords)**—dissolve the **East’s Green Affliction and Green Poison**.
- **South: Wù-Wǔ-Yǒu (Fire Qi Lords)**—dissolve the **South’s Red Affliction and Red Poison**.
- **West: Shēn-Yǒu-Xū (Metal Qi Lords)**—dissolve the **West’s White Affliction and White Poison**.
- **North: Hài-Zǐ-Chǒu (Water Qi Lords)**—dissolve the **North’s Black Affliction and Black Poison**.
- **Center: Wù-Jǐ (Earth Qi Lords)**—dissolve the **Center’s Yellow Affliction and Yellow Poison**.

*May the **Five Directions’ Qi** and the **Twelve Hours** pose no harm.*

*I have heard: the **upper three fives** belong to Heaven, the **middle three fives** to Man, the **lower three fives** to Earth. Heaven’s **Five Phases** govern clarity of sun and moon; Earth’s **Five Qi** nurture all things; Man’s **Five Constants** ensure vitality. When **ritual and music** are preserved, harmony is complete. I fear my household’s **Five Qi** are misaligned, my **zàng-fǔ** (viscera) disordered, the **Five Phases** clashing in destructive cycles. I humbly pray that the **Superior Officials** may:

- **Above**, dissolve the **Five Stars’ Auspicious Qi**,
- **Below**, lift the **Thirty-Six Earthly Taboos**,
- **Within**, absolve my **ten thousand sins and myriad offenses**.

*I further petition the **Seven Stars of the Big Dipper**:
- **Tānláng (Acquisition Wolf)** and **Jùmén (Supreme Gate)** to **sever the source of death**,
- **Lùcún (Luck Star)** and **Liánzhēn (Generosity)** to **replace the fatal form**,
- **Wénqū (Literary Curve)** and **Wǔqū (Martial Curve)** to **erase the death record**.

*I also petition the **Lords of Severing Afflictions, the Supreme Ancestral Blessing, the Lords of Fate and Qi, and the Jade Calendar Lords**, each with **120 officers**, to **apprehend and disperse my myriad calamities**, dissolving all afflictions—from the **First to the Ninth**—across my residence. May the **True Officials** record their **Qi**, oversee, and summon my **ancestors, parents, relatives, and in-laws**, granting them entry into the **Central Palace** for **official rank and rewards**, assigning them to bureaus by merit, promoting them by rank, and ensuring that the **living and the dead** receive blessings, with **spirits and mortals** aiding one another, so that my **lifespan may extend**, my **afflictions be surpassed**, and this petition proven true.*

In strict accordance with the prescribed rites, I humbly declare:

To the **Most High Laozi**, the **Lords of the Five Qi**, the **Celestial Master**, the **Gatekeepers**, and the **Lord of the Dao**, I beseech you to extend your grace and examine my case.

I pray to the **Yang Immortal, Protector of the Soul** and the **Yin Immortal, Protector of the Spirit** (*Pò*), as well as the **Celestial Nurturer of Life**, to massage my body, expel the **impure qi** from my spleen, lungs, and kidneys, and from the upper and lower **large and small intestines** and **bile bladder**, and to disperse the **obscure qi** from the **Abyssal Sea** (*Yōudū Qìhǎi*). May the **Dao-qi** circulate freely, all **hundred channels** flow unimpeded, and my afflictions and calamities vanish, my complexion radiant and luminous, like the sun and moon in brilliance.

I further pray to the **Supreme Sovereign of Ten Thousand Blessings**, the **Lord of Removing Afflictions**, **Father of the Eastern King**, and **Lady of the Western King**, each with five attendants, and to the **one hundred twenty officers** of the **Three Heavens and Nine Palaces**, including the **Officers of the Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches** (*Jiǎzǐ Jiǎwǔ Guānjūn*), that none of the **demonic poisons** may harm me.

With profound gratitude, I shall wholeheartedly fulfill this vow.

The grace is bestowed by the **Most High** as follows:

For my sake, I humbly petition the **Heavenly Bureau** to issue a decree for the **Protection of an Infant**.

---

**For the Supplication of a Dying Person:**

In strict accordance with the prescribed rites, I humbly declare:

I have received the **Celestial Master’s** teachings, and now, according to my records, I kneel and submit this plea. Since birth, my descendants have been fortunate to receive the **Dao**, and I am truly delighted and at ease.

Yet, my faith has often strayed from the teachings, bringing misfortune and calamity upon me. Now, on the **certain day of the certain month**, I am gravely ill, my body burdened, and my dreams chaotic and unkind.

I sought divination, and it revealed that the **deceased** (*wángrén*) is causing harm, with repeated entanglements, leading to this unending illness. I fear that death will not cease, and the affliction will never end, filling my household with dread. I fear my life may not be spared.

Today, my heart is filled with earnest supplication, and I beg you for a cure. I have already composed this plea and submitted it to the **Heavenly Bureau**. I humbly await your decree.

chunks.original_text: 求哀。 臣为某拜请 天官收除火殃口章一通，上诣 太上某宫曹治。 上清言功章 具法位， 上言：谨按文书牒，得某州某县弟子某，年若干，某月日生，伏自惟省，素以胎刍微蔑，宿缘幸会，得奉 大道，归命正真，荷四时所养，皇老好生，太上恶杀，赐臣气命，逮及今日，仰受太阳之恩，谬蒙师道之泽，赐署治箓，进叨《老君道德五千文》尊经，洞神洞玄洞渊洞真等法，奉受之日，要当供养宝文，修功立德，行合神仙，长生度世，永寿无极。 纵不得仙度，托命太阴，受炼更生，化为真人，免脱三涂。 道重人轻，实非尸肉所行参佩，广开法门，舟航一切，济度天人，存灵念真，餐御吐纳，注心玄极，修行生道。 非法不精，非法不真，但臣积世无状，七世已来，莫大之罪，结固未已，至有诚心，未能潜隐。 特以伏地奏闻，为臣所佩三洞经法等，五帝、真灵、玉女、直符、直事、领仙侍郎、监察大夫、日月星宿、五岳四渎、十方真官、法上将军、吏兵千乘万骑，悉同言功报劳，上诣 玄都，进品上仙，加爵帝秩，随科署真，无令遗失。 臣某家七祖父母，去离苦恼，上登天堂，衣食自然，天下太平。 臣某学道未备，俯仰之格，道法难精，前后施为，不合仪式，为四司所紏，五帝所执，千愆万过，乞蒙原赦。 臣某身中五体真官，受秩事竟，各还臣身中，保气全真，安稳如故。 恩惟 太上众真分别。

Your unworthy servants, born of vulgar times yet blessed by past merit, now behold the Great Transformation and take refuge in the Dao/Way. By Heaven’s and Earth’s nurture—nourished by the Red Spirit, fostered by the Yellow Emperor, guarded by stars, illuminated by sun and moon, sustained by the four seasons—we have received the breath of life and attained humanity. Though unworthy, we dare to crave the Dao/Way’s teachings, surrendering to the Most True. By imperial grace, we were granted the precepts, inner and outer talismans, the Three Five offices, and the Three Caverns’ Golden Scripts and Jade Tablets. We would also cultivate the self in stillness, drawing the sun’s essence into the heart’s void, refining the *qi* of practice through nine transformations of yin and yang, alchemizing the Five and Three into elixir, soaring through the void, ascending in broad daylight.

If our practice lacks precision, if our Dao/Way is untrue, we fear our past and present lives have committed the gravest offenses. We humbly beseech the **Divine Functionary of Merit** and the **Celestial Officers of Arms**, that they guard our bodies, prolong the lives of our green-robed kin, and shield our households.

to bear wondrous elixirs—sweet *lingzhi* mushrooms, golden nectar, jade essence—to nourish our offspring, secure the nation’s spirit, and ensure no harm befall them.

Having established my **lawful station**, I humbly submit:

In accordance with the **Mysterious Teachings**, it is recorded that the **Most High’s Dao-qi** has transformed all beings born of the womb—each with their coarse and impure essence—through its boundless grace, extending to the eight extremes. By bestowing **Dao-law** and nurturing all life, I, through fortune, have returned to the **Law-gate**. The **Celestial Master**, in compassion, has granted me this office.

Yet, with my base and vulgar nature, my senses dull and unassisted, I lack the means to aid others. Night and day, I tremble in anxiety, unable to find peace.

In accordance with the **Sacred Scriptures**, the **Celestial Master’s** decrees mandate three annual assemblies of merit, particularly on the fifth day of the tenth month, when all **Meritorious Deeds** are proclaimed.

I now enumerate the **talismans** under my charge, detailing their **Dao-words** and edicts: the **common folk and cultivated beings**, male and female, noble and lowly—all registered by **command, household, age, rank, and name**, as listed below.

Since the seventh day of the seventh month of this year, I have received the **Most High’s Three Celestial Dao of the Limitless**, the **Lords and Masters of the Law**, and the **Celestial Master’s Teachings**, instructing the people, healing the sick, and aiding the nation’s fate. Even the **fleshly beings** have abandoned vice for virtue, forsaken rebellion for obedience, cast off the old for the new, and discarded falsehood for truth.

As **Functionary of the Military and Divine Officials**, **Divine Decisor of Yin-Yang**, and **Keeper of the Twelve Hundred Official Spirits**, I petition the **Heavenly Officers and Military**, the **Mars and Venus Battalions**, the **Ghostly Qi Officials**, the **Supreme Pure Lord**, the **Five Qi Scripture Lords**, the **Vermilion Bird Lord**, the **Heavenly Physicians of Sun and Moon**, the **Harmonizing Physicians**, the **Daring and Vigorous Officials of the Primordial**, the **Lords of the Hundred Creatures**, the **Divine Males and Females**, the **Mysterious Males and Females**, the **Jade Males and Females**, the **Plain Males and Females**, the **Immortal Males and Females**, and the **Deceptive Officials and Transfiguring Lords**—that they heal sickness, resolve disputes, bless travel, oversee marriages and burials, and grant protection to supplicants.

Within my jurisdiction, the **Supervisory and Summoning Officials**, the **Two Mysterious, Three Primordial, and Four Beginning Lords**, and the **Four Wilds, Five Wilds, and Seven Wilds of the Levelled Districts** oversee the **fields, silkworms, and livestock**, providing double protection.

The **Celestial Master’s** appointed **Twenty-Four Administrations**, the **Thirty-Six Pacifying Lodges**, and the **Nine Regions and Eight Extremes’ Lords and Officials**, along with the **Five Directions’ Exorcising Lords and Officials**—the **Eastern Nine Yi**, the **Southern Eight Man**, the **Western Six Rong**, the **Northern Five Di**, and the **Central Three Qin**—and the **Yellow Book Commanders of the Twelve Monthly Decrees**, both **Male and Female Officials**, the **Twenty-Four Officials**, the **Male and Female Roles**, and the **Twenty-Four Roles**, as well as the **Household Talisman Officials** under their charge, petition the **Three Generals of the Residence** and the **Twenty-Four Officials**, along with **Three Hundred Thousand Soldiers**, the **Three Ancestral Generations and Five Ancestral Generations**, and the **Five Generals and Five Spirits**—that they safeguard the **fleshly beings’ households**, ensuring all remain upright.

To the **Laboring Lords and Exhausted Officials**, I pray that all may be **proclaimed for merit and promoted**.

As my understanding of **ghostly qi** is deficient, I humbly request the **Han Southern昌 Assembly Lords** and the **Restoration of Merit Lords**, along with **One Hundred Twenty Officials**, to oversee the **ranking of all officials**. Those with merit shall be **promoted accordingly**, their **ghostly qi** examined and rectified—from the **Ten Grades up to the Hundredth**, and from the **Thousandth up to the Ten Thousandth**—ascending to the **Central Palace** in proportion to their deeds, each returning to their original station.

For those **displaying merit**, let them be assigned to the **Convenience Bureau** with stable positions, lest they lose hope. Should any harbor resentment, let them be **proclaimed for merit and promoted** by the fifth day of the first month next year.

I and the **Dao-citizens** under my charge shall **recite the names in order**, as proof of sincerity.

For my countless sins and transgressions, I beseech **forgiveness from the Most High**.

**Awaiting the Most High’s decree.**

**Memorial of Merit and Function for the Triple Assembly**

Humble Daoist of [Certain] Prefecture and County, [Name], aged [X], born in the [month] of [year], prostrates and respectfully memorializes:

To the Most High Laozi, Celestial Master, Successor Master, Lineage Master, the Three Masters and their Consorts, and the Officials of the Gate:

I, [Name], a thousandfold fortunate, have encountered the Mysterious Wind and presumptuously entered the Dao-gate. Clad in the robes of the Way, I have been graciously initiated by the Venerable Teachers, granted sacred scriptures to rectify my life, and thus ascended from the first stage of Zhengyi to the utmost realm of Shangqing.

Alas, though my nature is coarse and the Law refined, my transgressions are vast. I neglect morning and evening incense-offerings, fail to observe the New Moon and Full Moon rites, miss the Triple Assembly and Triple Meeting rituals, and violate the solemnities of the Eight Festivals and Regengshen days. My body has been impure, clashing with the Celestial Officials; my words have betrayed my thoughts, violating statutes and prohibitions. Sometimes my mind wanders, generating vain fantasies; at others, my joy and anger are untimed, my drink and food excessive.

Such crimes are boundless, without measure—day by day, month by month, with no means to purify them. Now, on the auspicious day of the Triple Assembly in the year [X], I humbly present this **Memorial of Merit and Function for the Great Law** (one copy) and the **Memorial of Merit and Function for the Mixed Five and Seven Scriptures** (one copy), along with my offerings.

I pray that the Most High Three Sages and the Celestial Masters, in their boundless mercy, extend their boundless grace, washing away my past sins and absolving my former offenses. May I also beseech that the sacred scriptures I bear—such as the *Zhengyi Dongyuan* and others, including those of Shangqing, Shangxian, Shangling, the Two Officials and Soldiers, the Celestial Children and Jade Maidens, and the Civil and Martial Attendants—all speak of my merit and labor on my behalf, advancing my rank and bestowing rewards. When the merit is received, may all return to my person, soothing the officials and guarding my body.

May calamities and disasters be dispelled, decline and peril extinguished; may slander cease, and grudges harmonize. May the talismans, ritual texts, and sacred waters take effect. May my disciples flourish, and my abode remain serene. May my comings and goings be secure, and my petitions be granted.

I await the **Mysterious Creation’s** decree and respectfully submit this memorial.

**Memorial of the Acendency (Mengdu):**
[List of ritual positions and ranks]

Stricken by illness, burdened by suffering beyond remedy,
And thus they passed away.

We have followed customary rites,
Encoffining the body within the hall,
Completing all final arrangements.

Yet we cannot discern where **[Name of Deceased’s]** soul has taken refuge since their passing,
For fear that in their former life,

We know not what merit or virtue/power to perform,
To redeem them from the netherworld’s confines.

With reverence, we present our **ritual oath** and offerings,
To the **Five Directions’ Spirit Officials**,

That their path be opened in darkness,
Unobstructed by any hindrance.

With all beings now in harmony of heart,
We submit this request for Your approval.

Yet, as mere mortals, we lack understanding of the **cosmic qi** and its rhythms.
We beg Your benevolence to grant us mercy and relief.

The departed have already been **condemned by the Celestial Tribunals**, and my descendants have not yet been granted **redemption**. In the **netherworld’s obscurity**, they now **lament in sorrow**, suffering such litigations as:
- **Burial in water sources**,
- **Funeral rites obstructed by deities**,
- **Tombs pierced by burrowing**,
- **Coffins damaged by malevolent forces**,
- **Old tombs overlapping with new**,
- **New tombs encroaching upon the dead**,
As years and months pass, my descendants **remain unaware**, or endure **drowning by water, burning by fire**, **corruption by insects, or poison from medicines**. Even **uncles, aunts, brothers, and sisters**, or **aunts, cousins, and sisters**, may **successionally afflict** one another, bringing **misfortune and woe**.

If even one of these persists, they shall be **severely punished**—**Deng Palace’s records of guilt** will be invoked—and though they may **willingly confess**, the **Mystic Laws** will still **extend their mercy** to allow for **atonement**.

Thus, I humbly follow the **Thousand and Two Hundred Official Rituals**, as well as the **Orthodox One True Master’s** and the **Three Celestial Daoist Priests’** teachings on the **Method of the Southern Peak Purple Void Primordial Lord** to **quell diseases and banish malevolence**. I earnestly beseech the **Heavenly Champion Lord** to dispatch **Ten Million Yellow-Clad Soldiers** to **capture and annihilate** the **One Hundred Twenty Calamities** and **Strong (凶) Beasts** within my household, as well as the **Twelve Criminal Ghosts**, all of which I command to be **utterly destroyed**.

Further, I implore the **Supreme High Warehouse Lord**, with **One Million Soldiers**, to **restrain and subdue** the **Five Tomb Ghosts** who, through **wandering and lingering**, haunt my descendants, causing **calamities, misfortunes, illnesses, and endless injuries** to me. I decree their **total annihilation**.

Additionally, I call upon the **Lord of Qi and Disaster Resolution**, with **One Million Soldiers**, to **dispel and dissolve** the **inverted influences** within my household and the **Twelve Criminal Ghosts** afflicting me, along with the **One Hundred Twenty Calamities and Tribunals**, so that they may **cease their malevolent schemes** and **ward off the Six Celestial Qi’s** encroachment.

I also summon the **Great General of Beneficent Heaven**, with **One Million Soldiers**, the **Five Lords of Ten Thousand Blessings**, and **One Hundred Twenty Official Commanders**, as well as the **Lord of Stone Tranquility**, with **One Hundred Twenty Official Commanders**, and the **Lord of Northern Peace**, with **One Hundred Twenty Official Commanders**, to **ward off and expel** the lingering **malevolent forces** in the **Mystic Origin Palace**. They must **capture and punish** all **ghostly bandits** who, through **spirits and specters**, obstruct my family—**great and small**—and ensure their **immediate decimation**, so that I may **transcend death and embrace life**, and **turn misfortune into blessing**.

Moreover, I request the **Single Lord of Stone Immortality**, with **One Hundred Twenty Official Commanders**, to **ward off and annihilate** the **Strong (凶) Beasts** within my household, **suppressing all specters** and preventing further harm.

I also invoke the **Five Lords of the Four Aspects**, with **One Hundred Twenty Official Commanders each**, to **dispel and dissolve** the **malevolent forces and specters** within my household, which **disturb and harass** my dwelling, causing **instability and unrest**. They must **capture and sever**, **distinguishing pure from impure**, and **resolve all litigations and tribulations**.

Furthermore, I petition the **Lord of the Red Heaven Who Devours Qi**, with **One Hundred Twenty Official Commanders**, to **drive away and suppress** the **litigations of distant and near kin**, as well as those of **outsiders**, and to **apprehend all malevolent, vengeful, and slanderous spirits** who **persistently harass**, refusing to retreat. All such **spectral harm** must be **severed and utterly destroyed**.

Again, I summon the **Lord of the Supreme Divine Clarity**, with **One Hundred Twenty Official Commanders**, to **resolve and dispel** the **evil dreams and disorientations** plaguing me, where my **soul does not remain steadfast** and my **spirit wanders unrestrained**. May I **attain peace and clarity**, and have my **deep-rooted afflictions** **cease and disperse**.

I also beseech the **Lord of the Great Mystic**, with **One Hundred Twenty Official Commanders**, to **rectify the Mystic Origin Palace**, where **malevolent influences** within my household **disrupt the spirit**, cause **illness and affliction**, and induce **fright, confusion, and disorientation**, leaving me **unaware of my surroundings**. May these **malevolent forces** be **destroyed and their harm annulled**, so that my household may **forever be free from calamity**.

Additionally, I invoke the **Five Lords of Earth’s Control**, with **One Hundred Twenty Official Commanders each**, to **subdue the Netherworld’s Palace**. They must **dispel and dissolve** the **yearly, monthly, and daily influences of the Celestial Lifespan, the Soil King, and the Tomb Star**, as well as all **encroachments and offenses** against them, so that the **high and low, elder and younger ghosts** may **no longer cause harm**. All must be **utterly annihilated**.

I also call upon the **Supreme Lord of Heaven’s Birth**, with **One Million Soldiers**, and the **Supreme Lord of the Auspicious Aspect**, with **One Million Soldiers**, to **capture and resolve** the **sequential deaths** within my household, where **malevolent influences** persistently **harass and afflict**. I decree their **total destruction**.

Lastly, I implore the **General of Auspicious Protection** and his **officers and soldiers**, bearing the **Supreme Mystic True Talisman** and **carrying the Netherworld’s Green Edict**, along with the **Earthly Officials of the Second Rank** and the **Twenty-Four Prisons of Mount Tai**, to **capture and dispel** the **ghosts of ancestral litigation** within my tombs. They must **inform the Netherworld’s officials**, the **Mound Wardens, Tomb Marshals, Lord of the Blue Forest, Lord of the Martial Abyss**, the **Left and Right Tomb Lords**, the **Netherworld’s Official of the Tomb Excavation**, the **Right Rite Officer of the Reeds**, the **elders of the locality**, and all **regional authorities**, commanding them to **sever and cut off** all **ancestral malevolence and reafflicted influences**, and to **utterly destroy** them all.

If my ancestors have already **arrived in the Netherworld**, whether they **died before or after** me, and whether they be **male or female, elder or younger**, and wherever they are **buried**, should they **encroach upon the Twelve Monthly Stars, the Celestial Lifespan, the Eight Generals, the Six Oppositions, or any tabooed or forbidden influences**, causing **unfavorable sounds, improper burial rites, or obstruction of the living’s seats**, leading to **ancestral malevolence, illness in descendants, and perpetual unrest**, then I command all such **offenses** to be **explained and reconciled**, **restored according to their origins**, and **transformed from malevolence to benevolence**, from **misfortune to blessing**. Thus, **life and death, the living and the dead**, shall **no longer be entangled or influenced**.」

chunks.original_text: 请都星君，官将百二十人，治华盖宫； 诛殃君，官将百二十人，治仓明宫； 太白中阵明君，官将百二十人，并为某家七祖已来，先亡后化男女大小，解星官复连，收十二时刑祸迟留逆杀，皆使除灭死亡，断绝复注。 若下官故气，假托形影，导从鬼兵，驱逼先亡，伤注之鬼，去来家门，迫胁生人，拘录魂魄，致为疾病者，一依鬼律收治，皆令消灭。 又请无上天玄君，兵士一万二千人，为某收治远近贵贱尊卑男女，凡诸有谋口舌诽谤咒诅之气，皆令伏匿，不得为害。 又请赤砂君，官将百二十人，治南昌宫，为某家收五蛊六魅，百二十凶灾，及虚耗之鬼，常为某所居宅舍致费损不利者，皆令消灭。 凡上请二十四君官将吏兵，即日一合来下，各随本职，为某解散考谪，消除殃祟，和释诸所，断绝注气，先亡后死，及种族亲戚，有横暴枉滥、流亡客葬、无后之鬼，预是前八十一讼之事件，百万种种之考注，并各寝息，不得动作，一皆消荡。 若犹有欲兴造怨望，觇伺间隙，因垂衰便，构扇祸害者，尽皆收检剪扑，速令灭绝，不得与某有相关涉。 存亡异境，祸福各对，当令某身并家口，从今以去，神气流布，天灵辅卫，五藏调理，六腑宣通，真精内充，百病消歇，行业成就，功德日新，吉祥咸降，祆邪散灭，公私昌炽，存亡荷赖。 所请天官君将吏兵、文武职司，并立勤绩，驱除鬼害，收剪有功，请即为言功迁赏，加秩进爵，差次高下，如天曹常科，无使恚恨。 某所赍交脆，紫纹四十尺，命米一石二斗，钱一千二百文，着体摩衣一副，状纸一百二十张，墨两铤，笔两管，朱一两，书刀一口，净席一领，净巾一条，即以酬官君将吏勤劳之效。 恩惟太上云云。 臣谨为某身居疾病，解先亡后死者考气注逮，拜上大冢讼章一通，上诣云云。 又大冢讼章 起自茅山七真。 许长史云：欲上升，为上三世被冤家殃讼，有西灵夫人告令求道官拜奏冢讼章以解洗冤债。 其章具有仪注，若明日拜章，今夜具备浴室五所，如人之沐浴，具备如力，及先制小衣服三对，兼具银钱，献上先亡，以充洗洗。 明日奏启讫，即烧章。 随章烧衣服及钱财，亦须严洁，具备之。 又云：夫人家事破落，名宦不泰，死厄疾病，痛苦连年，生业不兴，子孙凌替，皆云上世考讼，亡灵不安，殃及生人子孙，致之如然。 能三年内频拜奏此章，当有大益。 章词临时看意改移，当从简正，不可烦渎。 具法位， 上言：谨有某官某乙，年若干岁，某月日生，贯某州县乡里，某为户头，即日叩头，稽首自列词状，素以胎诞，千生庆幸，得奉 大道，荷恩资育，得见今日。 伏以某身或有违杵，或有所求，或谋官宦，或疾厄，谢过，祈恩，任於此入语。 莫不因其修习乖违，所行逆理，建功补过，积善不及，上累先亡之祸，下责生人之咎，致令某乙怪梦非吉，所向多违，修念有阙，厄患臻集，虑不全生，莫悟考咎。 实惧上世已来，先亡后死，墓谪不解，冢讼相逮，告诉臣，求乞解释。 臣某伏按：人生禀阴阳之正气，受形气於父母，血胤连属，逮乎七世，傍贯伯叔，至于兄弟，莫不善恶同源，荣枯相继。 阳官赏罚，亦止此条； 幽府所施，岂宜广引。

I humbly petition the **Du Star Lord**, with one hundred twenty officials and soldiers, to govern the **Hua Gai Palace**; the **Zhuo Yang Lord**, with one hundred twenty officials and soldiers, to govern the **Cang Ming Palace**; and the **Tai Bai Zhong Zhen Ming Lord**, with one hundred twenty officials and soldiers, to **resolve the celestial connections** for my family’s seven generations henceforth—those who died before or after me, male or female, elder or younger—**dispelling the Twelve Hourly calamities, lingering malevolence, and untimely deaths**, ensuring all **death and suffering are extinguished** and **retaliatory qi is severed**.

Should any **residual malevolent qi** falsely assume form or shadow, **summon ghostly armies**, coerce the deceased, **injure those bound by burial taboos**, or **haunt my household**, **seizing souls and causing illness**, let them be **arrested under ghostly law** and **annihilated**.

Furthermore, I petition the **Supreme Celestial Lord of Heavenly Mystery**, with twelve thousand soldiers, to **subdue all slanderous, defamatory, and cursing qi**—whether from nobles or commoners, high or low, male or female—**forcing them into concealment**, preventing any harm.

I also petition the **Chi Sha Lord**, with one hundred twenty officials and soldiers, to govern the **Nan Chang Palace**, and **collect the Five Worms and Six Spirits**, the one hundred twenty calamities, and **wasteful ghosts** that **plague my home**, causing **loss and misfortune**. Let all such **malevolence be eradicated**.

All twenty-four petitioned lords, officials, soldiers, and clerks shall **immediately assemble below**, each performing their duties: **dissolving ancestral curses, dispelling calamities, reconciling disputes, severing retaliatory qi**, and **silencing the restless**—whether deceased ancestors, relatives, or those who died violently, were exiled, or perished without heirs—**including the eighty-one prior grievances and myriad ancestral retributions**, all **suppressed and rendered powerless**, unable to act. Should any persist in **fomenting resentment, lurking for opportunity, or exploiting weakness to incite harm**, let them be **arrested, suppressed, and utterly annihilated**, with no further influence over me.

May my **living and deceased** now exist in **separate realms**, with **fortune and misfortune distinct**. From this day forward, may my **vital essence flow harmoniously**, **celestial blessings guard me**, my **five zang and six fu regulate**, my **true essence replenish internally**, all **illnesses vanish**, my **endeavors prosper**, and **merit grow daily**, while **auspiciousness descends** and **malevolence disperses**, benefiting both **public and private spheres**. May all—living and dead—**rely upon this grace**.

The petitioned **celestial officials, soldiers, and clerks**, both civil and martial, shall **record their diligence**, **expel ghostly harm**, and **achieve merit in suppression**. I humbly request **promotion and rewards** in accordance with their ranks, as per the **Heavenly Tribunal’s standard procedures**, lest they harbor resentment.

I offer **forty bolts of purple-patterned silk**, twelve dou of rice, one thousand two hundred coins, a set of **ceremonial robes**, one hundred twenty sheets of petition paper, two catties of ink, two writing brushes, one liang of cinnabar, a writing knife, one mat, and one towel—**to recompense their labor**.

With deepest gratitude to the **Supreme Sage**.

I, **[Name]**, suffering illness, **petition to resolve the ancestral retributions** of my deceased, **presenting a Great Tomb Litigation Tablet** to the heavens.

Additionally, the **Great Tomb Litigation Tablet**, originating from the **Seven Immortals of Mao Shan**, states:

**Master Xu the Historian** said: *"To ascend, one must first resolve the grievances of the three past lives. The Western Spirit Lady instructed me to seek a Daoist official to petition this Tomb Litigation Tablet, thereby purifying ancestral debts."*

The tablet contains **ritual stipulations**. If petitioning tomorrow, tonight **prepare five bathing chambers**, as one would for purification, with **full devotion**, and **three sets of small garments**, along with silver and coins, **offered to the deceased for cleansing**.

After completing the petition tomorrow, **burn the tablet**. Alongside it, **burn the garments and coins**, ensuring all are **pure and complete**.

It is further said: *"If a family’s affairs decline, their lineage falters, and they suffer prolonged illness, misfortune, and stagnation—with descendants suffering—it is due to ancestral litigation and restless spirits **afflicting the living**. Petitioning this tablet **three times within a year** shall bring great benefit."*

Adjust the wording as needed, **keeping it concise and proper**, without redundancy.

**Ritual Position Established:**
I, **[Name]**, an official of **[Title]**, aged **[Age]**, born on the **[Day]** of **[Month]**, of **[Province]-[County]-[Village]**, with **[Name]** as household head, **now kneel and prostrate**, humbly stating:

By **birth and fortune**, I have **received the Dao’s blessings**, nurtured by its grace, and attained this life. Yet, I have **transgressed or sought improperly**—whether in **pursuing office, enduring illness, or seeking atonement**—all **recorded in this petition**.

My **deeds have strayed from virtue**, my **actions defied reason**, and though I **strive to amend**, my **merit is insufficient**. This has **invoked ancestral retribution** and **brought misfortune upon the living**, causing **ominous dreams, repeated setbacks, and lingering afflictions**. I fear **ancestral litigation persists**, with the deceased **petitioning me for resolution**.

I, **[Name]**, having investigated: **Human life draws from yin and yang’s pure qi**, received from parents, with **bloodline ties extending seven generations**, and **collateral relations to uncles and brothers**. **Virtue and vice are shared**, and **prosperity or decline follow in kind**. chunks.original_text: 服属既疏，为患自息。 且各有承嗣，不相滥混，臣以亡人魂爽，动以物接，记籍所明，为例甚众。 但肉眼障滞，不能照睹，巫觋所见，亦未穷察，当是形声既分，故音影莫会，至於光像，犹若于生。 然情念异同，不必遵旧，所以多致尤恨，亟为祸责。 今若不济彼苦津，离此怨路，则终成深害，咎祟方臻。 是以经教恳切，每念迁拔为本； 训诱款曲，必使解脱为先。 而当年在世，莫不罪多福少。 罪事既多，则久婴苦切； 福业既少，故理无所有。 是乃缠绵累业，殃注不已。 今虑某家先亡后死眷属名状，冥府自然，未皆放纵。 或有拘执责罚，便生讼引。 且七世久远，后胤莫测。 其中善恶不可详省。 今者既无的知其事，谨备显众目，具以陈言。

The bonds of service having grown distant, the afflictions naturally abate.
Moreover, each has their own descendants, not mingling indiscriminately.
I, considering the restless spirits of the deceased—
when they move, they interact with material forms—
the records confirm this, and such cases are numerous.

Yet, the fleshly eyes are obscured and cannot perceive,
while shamans and mediums, though they glimpse them,
have not thoroughly investigated.
This is because, once form and sound separate,
their echoes and shadows fail to converge,
and their luminous apparitions still resemble the living.

However, their emotions and attachments differ—
not necessarily bound by the past—
thus giving rise to many grievances and resentments,
which swiftly become calamities and blame.

Now, if we fail to ferry them across the suffering’s threshold,
to sever this path of resentment,
then the harm will deepen, and the retribution will only intensify.
Thus, the scriptures urge with earnestness:
to prioritize their transcendence as the foundation;
to guide them with gentle persuasion,
ensuring their liberation comes first.

Yet in their lifetimes, all were guilty of more wrongs than blessings.
With offenses so numerous, they endured prolonged suffering;
with merit so scarce, they had no grounds for redemption.
This is the entanglement of accumulated karma,
a calamity that knows no end.

Now, I fear that the deceased relatives of **[Name’s] family**—
their names and forms, their natural fates in the Netherworld—
are not entirely unrestrained.
Some may be detained under punishment,
thus provoking litigation and appeals.

Moreover, spanning seven generations is a vast expanse—
later descendants are beyond reckoning.
Their virtues and vices cannot be fully discerned.
Since we cannot now ascertain their deeds,
I solemnly present this before the assembled witnesses,
laying out the full account.

chunks.original_text: 葬非本墓之讼，诉非土域。 犯禁忌之讼，诉干触神位。 不安稳之讼，诉地气冲激。 高下四方之讼，各诉其处，更须转动。 六亲九族之讼，各诉其生人违背恩纪。 育子不养之讼，诉天性忍害，不得生成。 同姓之讼，诉无情礼。 异姓之讼，诉相轻滥。 无宅之讼，诉非所归。 无后之讼，诉绝祭杞。 愤慨之讼，诉志气不逞。 责怒之讼，诉人侵割。 悲伤之讼，诉多厄枉。 奄忽之讼，诉不获辞。 又生时所与人仇雠事，各有讼诉，并是怨结，莫申追想，引逮其亡后，所兴诸讼，皆由不能自忍，求对生人。 大略虽合八十一讼，其中枝叶分散，变成百千万种。 又有生为愆罪，死受责罚，汤煮火灼，风刀电解，负石凿山，漕江壅海，如此之目，复百千万条，悉皆讼引子孙，更相摄对。 又有阴伏匿怨，内疽隐恨，发念出言，起讼幽显。 或值时世不理，患难迫身，不胜哀忧，心悲口毒，剧言怨语，呼天唤地，辱晋光景，秽骂神祇，事彻晓冥，皆成讼考。 又立行丑逆，构业无良，犯诸科律禁诚，悉入考目。 百年、五十年、三十年、二十年、十年、一年、一月、一日、一时，积考相加，众考集并，命没已后，余考不息，缠绵累积，世世不穷。 不知某家七世已来，先亡后死，於此诸条，并何犯坐？ 或复舍命之日，不自甘分，怨天咎地，呼引鬼神，亦致遗殃相连，终不解释。 或有临民理务，枉刻无辜，杀人取财，囚人受货，因公行私，狠戾暴虐。 或妻妾闺闱，照察不明，信用偏邪，宠纵谗贼，持上逼下，怨酷丛生。 祝梼鬼巫，厌迮年命，使取魂魄，杀以偿咎，因是相讼，亦无穷极。 又恐某家七世已来，复有阴罪阴过，阳罪阳过，死罪死过，表裹沈迭，内外怨秽，无德无恩，不仁不孝，欺妄狡诈，违常悖理，塞源拔本，指是作非，天地所弗容，人伦所共弃，没命三官，皆婴对罚罪，相及世结，固督切考课，终无止息。 魂爽艰急，日就难忍，不堪荼毒，辞诉鬼官，求引生人，代其剧苦。 幽司虽明，亦有曲佞。 或能听理鬼言，移檄召对，致某家累年疾厄，频岁灾衰，光怪梦寤，钱财耗减，无可禳厌。 告乞玄师臣某，复览诰传，唯应分解冢讼墓注为急，直旨研明，窃思承奉，愿遵幽密，护物为功，驱驰谨按，未敢懈怠，但圣匠辽远，轨迹迁讹，迷非闷恨，靡知定本，辄极心究校，详尽愚诚，参顺经科，备伸虔奉，依法谨赍布素一百二十尺，五方缯纹、白素各八十尺，扫篇五枚，粪筐五枚，朱砂一两二分，席一领，状纸二百张，笔墨各二副，书刀一口，钱五千文，油一斤，香三两，米二石四斗，并先宿备沐浴洗浣之具。 臣谨为伏地拜章一通，特愿上官典者，垂神省览，为某家分解先亡后死冢讼诉注之气，令复注绝灭，逮害潜消，人鬼异路，生死乖隔。 谨请天官君，将吏兵各司所主，共为某家厌制墓气，解散殃咎，降某家冢痉之所。 又於酆都、泰山、河海、丘陵诸谪役之处，三官三府各随源检纠，必使洗释，辄按千二百官章仪，并正一真人所授南岳魏夫人治病制鬼之法，为某家上请太玄君五人，官将各百二十人，又请左右都候官将百二十人，治太明宫； 又请佑护将军吏兵，太玄真符，摄解冢墓殃注逮之鬼并阴害，加符告下某家，各用本音姓，角姓冢讼交通所属勾芒之神，征姓冢讼交通所属祝融之神，商姓冢讼交通所属薄收之神，羽姓冢讼交通所属玄冥之神，官姓冢讼交通所属勾陈之神也。
chunks.translated_text:
Burials in foreign graves, they allege the wrong earthly domain.

Violations of taboos, they allege offending the sacred positions of the spirits.

Unstable burials, they allege the disturbance of earthly *qi*.

Disputes over high and low or four-directional graves, each alleges their proper placement, yet demands further relocation.

Disputes among the six relatives and nine clans, each alleges their living kin betrayed the bonds of kinship and virtue.

Cases of nurturing children yet failing to raise them, they allege that Heaven’s nature permits endurance of suffering, yet they cannot fully mature.

Disputes with same-surname kin, they allege the absence of compassionate rites.

Disputes with different-surname kin, they allege mutual scorn and reckless transgression.

Cases of the homeless dead, they allege no proper resting place.

Cases of those without descendants, they allege the extinction of ancestral sacrifices.

Disputes from resentment, they allege their *zhìqi* not being fulfilled.

Disputes from blame and anger, they allege others encroaching upon them.

Disputes from grief, they allege excessive misfortune and wrongs.

Disputes from sudden death, they allege no chance to speak.

Again, during life, any grudges or feuds with others, each has its own disputes, all arising from lingering resentments—none can be traced or recalled—yet they summon the deceased’s descendants, and all disputes stem from the inability to endure suffering, demanding retribution from the living.

Though broadly encompassing the eighty-one disputes, their branches and leaves scatter, multiplying into myriad cases.

There are also those who, in life, committed offenses and, in death, suffer punishments—boiled in hot water, scorched by fire, cut by windblades, dissolved by lightning, burdened with stones, crushed in mountains, dredging rivers, blocking seas—such calamities, numbering countless thousands, all drag their descendants into litigation, passing blame through generations.

Further, there are hidden grudges and concealed resentments, festering sores and suppressed hatreds, which erupt in thoughts and words, spawning disputes both seen and unseen.

Some, in times when justice is not upheld, face dire straits, unable to bear their sorrow, their hearts heavy with grief and tongues bitter with curses. They utter harsh complaints, invoke Heaven and Earth, defame the luminous and sacred, revile the gods and spirits, and their grievances reach the Underworld, all becoming grounds for litigation.

Or those who, in life, committed heinous crimes, built no virtuous deeds, and violated all laws and prohibitions—all such cases are entered into the records of judgment.

A hundred years, fifty years, thirty years, twenty years, ten years, one year, one month, one day, one hour—accumulated punishments add up, and all these judgments combine. After death, the remaining punishments do not cease; they cling and accumulate, endlessly across generations.

The tormented soul, restless and anguished, grows ever harder to bear, unable to endure suffering. They implore the ghostly officials to summon their living kin, demanding they face their agonies instead.

Though the Underworld’s judgments are clear, there are still those who twist and pervert justice. Some can hear the ghosts’ pleas and issue summons, causing a family to suffer endless illnesses and calamities year after year, strange omens in dreams, dwindling wealth, with no way to avert disaster.

The petitioner humbly begs the celestial master of the dark realm to review the edicts and records, and only the urgent matter of resolving grave disputes and burial records should be addressed. The petitioner, though distant from the sacred and revered, and though the paths may have strayed and been lost, seeks to clarify the source of their suffering with utmost sincerity. They follow the rites of the thousand-two-hundred officials, and the true methods taught by the One True Person to the Southern Peak Wei Lady for healing and pacifying spirits, to request on behalf of the family:

- That the Heavenly Official Lord dispatch five officers, each with a hundred and twenty soldiers,
- And that the Left and Right Marshals of the Underworld be summoned, each with a hundred and twenty soldiers, to oversee the Great Bright Palace.

The petitioner further requests the Generals of Protection and their soldiers, along with the Heavenly Official’s true talismans, to seize and disperse all the ghosts tied to grave disputes and burial records, as well as those causing hidden harm. They shall then issue a proclamation to the family, using their original names and surnames, to:

- Confront the god of grave disputes and burial records under the jurisdiction of the Gōngmáng (勾芒) deity,
- Summon the god of grave disputes and burial records under the jurisdiction of the Zhūróng (祝融) deity,
- Invoke the god of grave disputes and burial records under the jurisdiction of the Bóshōu (薄收) deity,
- Call upon the god of grave disputes and burial records under the jurisdiction of the Xuánmíng (玄冥) deity,
- And appeal to the god of grave disputes and burial records under the jurisdiction of the Gōuchén (勾陈) deity.

chunks.original_text: 及丘丞墓伯、地下二千石、苍林君、武夷君、左右冢侯、地中司激墓卿右秩、蒿里父老，诸是地域所典主者，并严加断绝某家冢讼之气、复注之鬼。 若某家自上系高曾祖父母已来，诸冢墓所在，有犯十二月建破王耗、八将六对、伤绝禁忌、音向不正、哺次不得、左前右后、伏尸某姓男女位坐，并为刑祸，虚耗不息，妨害子孙者，兼为解释，和合补复，使生死咸安。 即请大玄君，官将百二十人，治无渠官。 又请九地君，官将百二十人，治茂理宫。 一合下，主为某家分解葬埋所犯十二月建破王耗，及十二丘墓冢讼之鬼，一切须灭。 又请都星君五人，官将百二十人，治仓明官。 又请太白中阵明星君，官将百二十人等，一合下，并解某家七世已下，前升后化亡人、星宿官将复连，收十二刑祸，迟留逆杀，除落死名，止杀灭殃。 又请赤天食气君，官将百二十人，主驱斥亲疏远近及有异姓讼，逮诸凶恶之鬼。 又请无上高仓君，兵士十万人，主收五墓之鬼，伤死往来病祟生人者。 又请四胡君，官将百二十人，主消考讼之鬼、不正之气，致不安稳者。 又请收神上明君，官将百二十人，主收韬转（车＋禀）不宁、恶梦错乱、魂魄不守者。 又请天昌君、黄衣兵士十万人，主收某家中百二十殃怪、中外强（歹＋羊）、十二月刑杀鬼。 又请盖天大将军十万人，主为某家辟斥故气，断绝注鬼，却死来生，却祸来福。 又请太白君百万人，都官从事，考对杀君，各有种数千万人，一合下，营护某身并某家，却死籍，上生名，断祖世中外亡人死注。 清浊之气，破杀尸殃之鬼，不得伺候牵引，更相注逮。 若下官故气，假托形影，道从鬼兵，胁迫亡人，还逮家门者，一依女青诏书律令，收治绝灭。 所请十五君，官将吏兵等，愿一合来下，各随本职，为某解除亡人考谪，疗治众苦，痛恼之疾，尽得平安。 克使讼诉不生，殃注绝息。 某家诸先亡后死中种族异姓、亲戚周旋、朋友、奴婢、仆妾，横暴枉滥，流亡客葬，无后之鬼，预是前八十一讼之事，及百千万种殃考注逮等，各皆潜宁休息，不得复动作为害。 若犹欲怨望，觇伺间隙，构扇祸害者，各尽收执，速令永灭，不使更兴。 章御之后，赐某家前亡后死祖世亡人，罪蒙原赦，魂升三天，冢墓安宁，考讼沉静，福被当今，庆流后代，子孙隆茂，宦学光显，计图胜展，公私利昌，疾病除差，怪消梦正，存亡获福，以为效信。 所请天官，依都章言功，不负丹誓。 恩唯 太上分别。 求哀臣愚。
